selection_reasoning: Selected the top three trials which are all very close to the 2.635 target, using jiggling, CVT, and growth strategies. Retained the DE-based max-min approach for topological diversity.

trial_selections.reasoning: Highest score (2.6299). The 'Circle Jiggling' local search is extremely effective at fine-tuning high-quality configurations.
Very strong score (2.6296) using a robust multi-start CVT approach. This provides a high-quality alternative topology to the growth-based methods.
Solid performance (2.6281) with a refined growth/repulsion simulation. This physics-based approach is good at discovering new packing structures.
Uses a Max-Min distance objective via Differential Evolution. While the score is lower (2.6032), this approach is the best at finding fundamentally different global arrangements.
